question_sentence: The University of Sussex has been fined more than £500,000 for failing to do what?
choices: Mark essays in a timely manner
Give students access to library resources
evidence: The University of Sussex has been fined £585,000 by the higher education regulator, the Office for Students (OfS), for failing to uphold freedom of speech. It said the university's policy statement on trans and non-binary equality, including a requirement to "positively represent trans people", could lead staff and students with opposing views to "self-censor".

question_sentence: In South Africa, fishing restrictions will soon be in place near the breeding grounds of which endangered species?
evidence: In South Africa, fishing restrictions will soon be in place near the breeding grounds of endangered African penguins to guard them from extinction.

question_sentence: Which famous Brit is being credited with a marked rise in beard transplants?
evidence: Since Prince William debuted his beard last year, one Istanbul clinic said it had seen a 200% increase in beard transplants. "They think it looks rugged and masculine," Murat Alsac, co-founder of a Turkish hair transplant clinic, told the Daily Express, dubbing it the "Prince William effect".

question_sentence: Former professional boxer Iwao Hakamada was once the world’s longest-serving death row inmate until he was acquitted. How much compensation was he awarded?
evidence: Former professional boxer Iwao Hakamada has been awarded $1.4 million in compensation, "roughly $85 for each day he was wrongfully convicted", said CNN. Before he was acquitted because of DNA evidence, he spent more than 40 years on death row.

question_sentence: Chancellor Rachel Reeves faced criticism after accepting free tickets to which pop star's concert?
evidence: Labour ministers have criticised Rachel Reeves for accepting a freebie after it emerged she received free tickets worth £600 to a Sabrina Carpenter gig at London's O2 last year. She has since said she would not accept such tickets in future.

question_sentence: President Trump said he would impose a "25% tariff on all cars not made in the US" from 3 April. By how much could prices on imported vehicles increase if the full tax is passed on to US consumers?
evidence: President Trump said he would impose a "25% tariff on all cars not made in the US", starting on 3 April. If the full tax is passed on to consumers in the US, prices on imported vehicles "could jump by $12,500, a sum that could feed into overall inflation", The Associated Press said.

question_sentence: What is the name of the charity Prince Harry stood down from this week?
evidence: The Duke of Sussex co-founded Sentebale, the HIV and Aids charity, in 2006 in honour of his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales. But he has stepped down, along with his co-founder, Prince Seeiso of Lesotho, and the board of trustees after its relationship with chair Dr Sophie Chandauka "broke down beyond repair". She had been asked to resign and then took legal action against the charity.

question_sentence: In what state did a jury order Bayer to pay almost $2.1 billion in damages to a man who said the German chemical and pharmaceutical company’s Roundup weed killer caused his cancer?
evidence: A Georgia jury ordered Bayer, the corporation that acquired Monsanto, to pay almost $2.1 billion in damages to a man who said the German company's Roundup weed killer caused his cancer, according to his lawyers.

question_sentence: Which famous sporting event is embroiled in a "slimy" row over who is allowed to compete?
evidence: The Oxford University crew have been accused of "slimy" tactics ahead of next month's Boat Race after four Cambridge rowers, including former double world champion Matt Heywood, were barred from competing owing to a ban on postgraduate teaching students. The dispute has escalated to the point where the vice-chancellors of both universities may intervene.

question_sentence: What is the branding term that President Trump is using to refer to 2 April?
evidence: Donald Trump is calling 2 April "Liberation Day". It's a branding term for the moment when Trump's promised regime of retaliatory tariffs against America's trading partners comes into effect. And it could shake up the global economy.

question_sentence: Top members of President Donald Trump’s Cabinet recently sent detailed operational plans and other likely classified information about US military strikes in Yemen to a group chat that included a journalist. Which app did they use?
evidence: The messages were sent over Signal, an unclassified commercial messaging app that security officials fear might be vulnerable to foreign hackers.

question_sentence: At a time when the Pentagon is looking to slash its budget, President Trump wants to ensure there’s still funding for one of his top priorities. What is the project called?
evidence: Trump’s “Golden Dome” project would create a defense system capable of protecting the entire United States from long-range missile strikes, much like Israel’s “Iron Dome.”

question_sentence: Which famed French restaurant recently lost one of its Michelin stars?
evidence: Georges Blanc, the world’s longest-standing Michelin-starred restaurant, had boasted a three-star rating since 1981.

question_sentence: Actor Pedro Pascal said he felt "violated" when paparazzi photos revealed which secret about him?
choices: His inability to throw a frisbee
evidence: “The Last of Us” star would like a little bit of privacy after photos revealed his insanely strong beverage order at Starbucks of six espresso shots on the side of the cup.

question_sentence: A United Airlines flight from Los Angeles to China had to turn around and make an unscheduled stop in San Francisco recently for which reason?
choices: A passenger attempted to open an emergency exit
The plane’s inflight entertainment system malfunctioned
evidence: Although the unexpected delay threw a wrench in her plans, one passenger said she appreciated the pilot’s honesty.

question_sentence: An oil painting of Donald Trump will soon be removed from the Colorado state Capitol after the president said it was what?
evidence: Trump described the painting, which was unveiled in 2019, as “purposefully distorted.”

question_sentence: A rock on display for 20 years at an Australian high school hid which secret in plain sight?
choices: A cache of fossilized dinosaur footprints
evidence: The discovery represents one of the highest concentrations of dinosaur footprints per square meter ever documented in the country.

question_sentence: A group of Midwestern women who regularly use marijuana say it makes them better moms. What do they call themselves?
evidence: The “Cannamoms” say they use marijuana to cope with the stresses of life and motherhood.

question_sentence: Dairy farmers in France are turning to which of the following as an alternative to “chemical treatments” for cattle?
evidence: Farmers are using acupuncture to improve the immune systems of their cows, increase milk production and help with other health issues.

question_sentence: A mysterious glowing spiral was spotted over Europe after a recent SpaceX launch. What caused the phenomenon?
choices: An experiment on the International Space Station
A reflection cast by solar panels near the launch site
The rocket’s exhaust interacting with the atmosphere
evidence: According to the UK National Meteorological Service, the mysterious spiral likely formed when the rocket’s exhaust interacted with the atmosphere.
